title: Patriots’ Jahlani Tavai will miss Bengals game due to personal reasons
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: New England Patriots The Patriots will be without the veteran linebacker this weekend in Cincinnati.
Jahlani Tavai.
AP Photo/Gary McCullough Patriots linebacker Jahlani Tavai will not be available to play against the Bengals on Sunday, coach Mike Vrabel told reporters Friday afternoon.

title: 5 must-watch movies & TV shows streaming right now
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Streaming The best of what's new streaming on Netflix, Hulu, HBO Max, Disney Plus, and more.
What to watch: Ted Danson as Charles, Mary Steenburgen as Mona in Season 2 "A Man on the Inside," now streaming on Netflix.
Colleen E.

title: Alex Cora gives ominous quote about future managing the Red Sox
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Boston Red Sox "It's getting harder and harder.
To have a chance to win, that's all I want.
" Alex Cora is entering his eighth season as Red Sox manager.

title: Jaylen Brown opened up about ‘no left-hand jokes’, and the playoff loss that ‘shifted’ his mentality
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Boston Celtics "We hadn't won a championship.
It killed me bro.
I wanted to win more than anything.

title: Patriots-Bengals injury report: Joe Burrow questionable, while New England set to get back two key offensive contributors
author: Conor Roche
bullets: New England Patriots The Patriots might not face Burrow after all.
Joe Burrow might return from his toe injury to face the Patriots on Sunday.

AP Photo/Kareem Elgazzar By Conor Roche November 21, 2025 | 3:25 PM 2 minutes to read Friday brought some relatively good news for the Patriots on the injury front, and they might be avoiding Joe Burrow when they take face the Bengals on Sunday.

title: 5 best new restaurant openings and dining updates in Boston (Nov. 21, 2025)
author: Katelyn Umholtz
bullets: Food Stay up to date on the best new restaurants, recent openings, and the biggest dining updates across Greater Boston's food scene.
Another New City Microcreamery is opening in Greater Boston, with one taking over the former White Mountain Creamery.

title: Watch: Noah Kahan performs new, unreleased song ‘Deny Deny Deny’
author: Heather Alterisio
bullets: Concerts The two-time Grammy-nominated singer promised a new album is on the way.
Noah Kahan performs during a benefit concert for the Busyhead Project and Red Sox Foundation at MGM Music Hall in Boston, Massachusetts Thursday, November 20, 2025.
Rachel O’Driscoll/Boston Red Sox ShareSend this article to your social connections.

title: Watch: Niall Horan joins Noah Kahan on stage for ‘Northern Attitude’
author: Heather Alterisio
bullets: Concerts Kahan invited the Irish singer-songwriter on stage Thursday night to help him sing "Northern Attitude" at MGM Music Hall at Fenway.
Noah Kahan performs during a benefit concert for the Busyhead Project and Red Sox Foundation at MGM Music Hall in Boston, Massachusetts Thursday, November 20, 2025.

title: Celtics head coach Joe Mazzulla gives an interesting definition for what he views as fun
author: Aidan Buchanan
bullets: Boston Celtics “Just in general, I don’t get joy from winning.
” Joe Mazzulla applauding the Celtics against the Grizzlies on November 12 (Charles Krupa/AP Photo).
Whether it’s coaching the NBA Finals or beating a team of reporters by more tha 50 points, there’s one trait of Joe Mazzulla that won’t be questioned: his competitiveness.

title: Review & setlist: No fumbles but plenty of ecstasy in sublime Sarah McLachlan show
author: Marc Hirsh
bullets: Concert Reviews The Lilith Fair founder made it to Boston's Orpheum Theatre Thursday after laryngitis scuttled her 2024 shows.
Sarah McLachlan rehearsing for her tour last year.
She finally made a stop at Boston's Orpheum Thursday night.
